vague_description: How to balance maximizing visitor transport while minimizing environmental impact at a mountainous tourist location.
detailed_description: A tourist spot in the mountains allows visitors to travel to the top either by hot-air balloon or gondola lift. A hot air balloon can carry \param{BalloonCapacity} visitors while a gondola lift can carry \param{GondolaCapacity} visitors. Each hot air balloon produces \param{BalloonPollution} units of pollution while each gondola lift produces \param{GondolaPollution} units of pollution. There can be at most \param{MaxBalloons} hot-air balloon rides and at least \param{MinVisitors} visitors need to be transported. How many of each type of transport method should be taken to minimize the total pollution produced?
target_objective: Minimize the total pollution produced by the hot-air balloons and gondola lifts
target_constraints: Number of hot-air balloon rides is non-negative
Number of gondola lift trips is non-negative
At most MaxBalloons hot-air balloon rides can be offered
At least MinVisitors visitors must be transported
target_parameters: Capacity of one hot air balloon ride
Pollution produced by one hot air balloon ride
Pollution produced by one gondola lift
Maximum number of hot air balloon rides
Minimum number of visitors to be transported
